title: Care Worker
qualifications_required: Formal training or certification in care assistance
experience_required: Experience in providing personal care and support to individuals
description:
Care Worker - Band 4

We are currently seeking a compassionate and dedicated Care Worker to join our team. As a Care Worker, you will provide personal care, practical support, and emotional assistance to individuals in their homes or in residential care settings. Your role will involve assisting with daily living activities, providing companionship, and monitoring a person's condition.

Reporting to the Care Manager, your key responsibilities will include assisting with personal hygiene, dressing, and eating, as well as providing emotional support and companionship. You will also be responsible for household tasks and medication administration, ensuring the safety and well-being of our clients.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Experience in providing personal care and support to individuals
  • Ability to assist with daily living activities, such as personal hygiene, dressing, and eating
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to provide emotional support and companionship
  • Basic knowledge of household tasks and medication administration

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary based on Band 4
  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Location: various locations in the UK

title: Senior Carer
qualifications_required: NVQ Level 3 in Health and Social Care or equivalent qualification
experience_required: Previous experience working as a care assistant or senior carer in a care home setting
description:
The Senior Carer is a vital role within our care home, responsible for providing high-quality care and support to our residents. As a Senior Carer, you will lead and supervise a team of care assistants, ensuring that all care is delivered in a person-centered and compassionate manner. Your role will involve care planning, medication administration, and promoting the wellbeing and independence of our residents. You will work collaboratively with other healthcare professionals and maintain accurate records of care provided. title: Marketing Executive
experience_required: Experience in developing and implementing marketing strategies, project management skills, analytical and problem-solving abilities, experience in content creation and management, strong understanding of social media platforms and their analytics
description:
The Marketing Executive will be responsible for establishing the company as a thought leader in the industry, growing public awareness of the company, and communicating the company's mission and values to the public. They will develop and implement a marketing strategy, manage the day-to-day operations of the company's marketing department, and oversee marketing campaigns. The Marketing Executive will report to the Marketing Manager.

The key responsibilities of the Marketing Executive include developing the department's marketing calendar, workflows, and content team's "course of action". They will also analyze various types of data to build content strategies and review each piece of content before it goes live to ensure it meets quality standards and is error-free. The Marketing Executive will also promote content and track and measure its performance.

The ideal candidate for this role will have experience in developing and implementing marketing strategies, strong project management skills, and excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. They should also have experience in content creation and management and a strong understanding of social media platforms and their analytics. Desirable criteria include experience in the same or similar industry, experience in managing a team, knowledge of SEO and digital marketing techniques, and experience in data analysis and reporting.

  • Competitive salary (Band 5)
  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Located in the UK

title: Care Team Coordinator
experience_required: Previous experience in a similar role
description:
The Care Team Coordinator will be responsible for coordinating scheduling for care staff, supervising care plans and ensuring compliance, serving as the main point of contact between clients and staff, and updating digital care logs and managing staff documentation. title: Night Shift Cleaner
experience_required: Previous experience in a cleaning role
description:
The Night Shift Cleaner will be responsible for maintaining cleanliness and sanitation in various areas of The Cock Inn. This includes cleaning and sanitizing, waste disposal, surface cleaning, maintaining cleanliness, reporting any safety hazards, and performing deep cleaning tasks. The role may also involve supervising and coordinating the activities of other cleaning staff.

The Night Shift Cleaner reports to the Manager and is responsible for ensuring that all areas of The Cock Inn are kept clean and sanitized. They must have good communication skills and attention to detail in order to follow safety procedures and maintain cleanliness. The role may also involve supervising and coordinating the activities of other cleaning staff.

The ideal candidate for this role will have previous experience in a cleaning role and the ability to work night shifts. They must also have good communication skills and attention to detail. Desirable criteria include supervisory experience, experience with deep cleaning tasks, knowledge of health and safety regulations, experience in a hospitality or food service environment, and a basic understanding of cleaning equipment and products.

  • Competitive salary in Band 2
  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Night shift hours

title: Support Worker
working_hours: Flexible shifts, including nights and weekends
qualifications_required: NVQ Level 2 in Health and Social Care
experience_required: Minimum 6 months experience in a support or care role
description:
We are currently seeking a dedicated and empathetic Support Worker to join our team. This role involves providing care and daily assistance to individuals with learning disabilities, autism, or mental health conditions. You will be based in supported living settings across Leeds, supporting service users to live as independently as possible.

Key responsibilities for this role include assisting with personal care, household tasks, medication administration, and supporting clients with social integration and appointments. You will report to the Service Manager and work closely with a team of support workers to ensure the well-being and safety of our service users.

To be considered for this role, you must have a minimum of 6 months experience in a support or care role. A NVQ Level 2 in Health and Social Care is preferred, along with excellent communication and interpersonal skills. You must also have the ability to work flexible shifts, including nights and weekends, and have the right to work in the UK. A good understanding of safeguarding and person-centred care is also essential.

  • Competitive salary within Band 4
  • Opportunities for career development and progression
  • Flexible working hours
